title: CONTINUE: Verifier - validate all proofs compile and exercises are solvable

comments.author: jwalsh
comments.text:
## Verification Report - All Lean Files

### Summary: PASS

All 7 Lean files compile successfully. Exercises have expected sorry placeholders, and all solutions compile without errors or sorry statements.

---

### File Verification Details

| File | Status | Notes |
|------|--------|-------|
| O1Sort.lean | PASS | Compiles cleanly, no errors |
| exercises/Ex01_Basics.lean | PASS | 14 sorry warnings (expected) |
| exercises/Ex02_NaturalNumbers.lean | PASS | 19 sorry warnings (expected) |
| exercises/Ex03_Lists.lean | PASS | 22 sorry warnings (expected) |
| exercises/Solutions/Sol01_Basics.lean | PASS | 2 unused variable warnings (minor) |
| exercises/Solutions/Sol02_NaturalNumbers.lean | PASS | Compiles cleanly |
| exercises/Solutions/Sol03_Lists.lean | PASS | Compiles cleanly |

---

### Verification Checks

1. **O1Sort.lean compiles**: YES
2. **All exercises compile (sorry allowed)**: YES - All 3 exercise files compile with expected sorry placeholders
3. **All solutions compile without errors**: YES - All 3 solution files compile successfully  
4. **No stray sorry in solutions**: VERIFIED - grep confirms no sorry statements in any solution file

---

### Minor Issues (non-blocking)

Sol01_Basics.lean has 2 linter warnings for unused variables:
- Line 68: unused variable `hq` in use_first theorem
- Line 72: unused variable `hp` in use_second theorem

These are intentional for pedagogical purposes (showing how to select specific hypotheses).

---

### Lean Version
- Lean 4.23.0 (x86_64-unknown-freebsd14.3, Release)

### Conclusion
All Lean files are valid and the exercises are solvable (solutions provided and verified).
